title: Search highlighting in user guide / documentation
body:
While the 3.x documentation looks great overall, there's a pretty huge issue with usability and colors when using the search (on broad topics â€“ e.g. "send email" to look up how to send an email).

On the found pages the highlighting of the search terms breaks every visual hierarchy and distracts and confuses the viewer due to the really intense contrast background.
Example: http://www.codeigniter.com/user_guide/libraries/email.html?highlight=send%20email

![screen shot 2015-05-20 at 17 11 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5183232/7729111/48575cba-ff13-11e4-8f12-4c6aa2541cfa.png)

How one is supposed to even scan the content for the answer he or she desires is beyond me.
Also when using the search as a replacement for the documentation index, the highlighting (e.g. "input" to quickly access the input class) is completely unnecessary and immensly distracting. 

So at the very least I suggest using a highly transparent color so that the highlighting looks more like that of a textmarker which enables the reader to concentrate on the whole content, not only the highlighted words.

Demo:
![screen shot 2015-05-20 at 17 10 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5183232/7729130/55df34a2-ff13-11e4-80ae-373fc316cf27.png)

The color `rgba(241, 230, 15, 0.2)` should do it. The horizontal padding of 6px can also be reduced or ommited for the sake of readability.

What do you think?
